leaf.title: accesskey
leaf.tooltip: Keyboard shortcut to activate or add focus to the element.

leaf.title: autocapitalize
leaf.tooltip: Sets whether input is automatically capitalized when entered by user

leaf.title: class
leaf.tooltip: Often used with CSS to style elements with common properties.

leaf.title: contenteditable
leaf.tooltip: Indicates whether the element's content is editable.

leaf.title: contextmenu
leaf.tooltip: Defines the ID of a <menu> element which will serve as the element's context menu.

leaf.title: data-*
leaf.tooltip: Lets you attach custom attributes to an HTML element.

leaf.title: dir
leaf.tooltip: Defines the text direction. Allowed values are ltr (Left-To-Right) or rtl (Right-To-Left)

leaf.title: draggable
leaf.tooltip: Defines whether the element can be dragged.

leaf.title: hidden
leaf.tooltip: Prevents rendering of given element, while keeping child elements, e.g. script elements, active.

leaf.title: id
leaf.tooltip: Often used with CSS to style a specific element. The value of this attribute must be unique.

leaf.title: lang
leaf.tooltip: Defines the language used in the element.

leaf.title: role
leaf.tooltip: Defines an explicit role for an element for use by assistive technologies.

leaf.title: slot
leaf.tooltip: Assigns a slot in a shadow DOM shadow tree to an element.

leaf.title: spellcheck
leaf.tooltip: Indicates whether spell checking is allowed for the element.

leaf.title: style
leaf.tooltip: Defines CSS styles which will override styles previously set.

leaf.title: tabindex
leaf.tooltip: Overrides the browser's default tab order and follows the one specified instead.

leaf.title: title
leaf.tooltip: Text to be displayed in a tooltip when hovering over the element.

leaf.title: translate
leaf.tooltip: Specify whether an element's attribute values and the values of its Text node children are to be translated when the page is localized, or whether to leave them unchanged.

leaf.title: accept-charset
leaf.tooltip: <form> List of supported charsets.

leaf.title: accept
leaf.tooltip: <form>, <input> List of types the server accepts, typically a file type.

leaf.title: action
leaf.tooltip: <form> The URI of a program that processes the information submitted via the form.

leaf.title: align
leaf.tooltip:
, , , ,
,

leaf.title: allow
leaf.tooltip: <iframe> Specifies a feature-policy for the iframe.

leaf.title: alt
leaf.tooltip: , , , Alternative text in case an image can't be displayed.

leaf.title: async
leaf.tooltip: <script> Executes the script asynchronously.

leaf.title: autocomplete
leaf.tooltip: <form>, <input>, <select>, <textarea> Indicates whether controls in this form can by default have their values automatically completed by the browser.

leaf.title: autofocus
leaf.tooltip: <button>, <input>, <keygen>, <select>, <textarea> The element should be automatically focused after the page loaded.

leaf.title: autoplay
leaf.tooltip: <audio>, <video> The audio or video should play as soon as possible.

leaf.title: background
leaf.tooltip: <body>, <table>, <td>, <th> Specifies the URL of an image file. Note: Although browsers and email clients may still support this attribute, it is obsolete. Use CSS background-image instead.

leaf.title: bgcolor
leaf.tooltip: <body>, <col>, <colgroup>, <marquee>, <table>, <tbody>, <tfoot>, <td>, <th>, <tr> Background color of the element. Note: This is a legacy attribute. Please use the CSS background-color property instead.

leaf.title: border
leaf.tooltip: ,

leaf.title: buffered
leaf.tooltip: <audio>, <video> Contains the time range of already buffered media.

leaf.title: capture
leaf.tooltip: <input> From the Media Capture specification, specifies a new file can be captured.

leaf.title: challenge
leaf.tooltip: <keygen> A challenge string that is submitted along with the public key.

leaf.title: charset
leaf.tooltip: <meta>, <script> Declares the character encoding of the page or script.

leaf.title: checked
leaf.tooltip: <input> Indicates whether the element should be checked on page load.

leaf.title: cite
leaf.tooltip: <blockquote>, <del>, <ins>, <q> Contains a URI which points to the source of the quote or change.

leaf.title: codebase
leaf.tooltip: <applet> This attribute gives the absolute or relative URL of the directory where applets' .class files referenced by the code attribute are stored.

leaf.title: code
leaf.tooltip: <applet> Specifies the URL of the applet's class file to be loaded and executed.

leaf.title: color
leaf.tooltip: <font>, <hr> This attribute sets the text color using either a named color or a color specified in the hexadecimal #RRGGBB format. Note: This is a legacy attribute. Please use the CSS color property instead.

leaf.title: colspan
leaf.tooltip: <td>, <th> The colspan attribute defines the number of columns a cell should span.

leaf.title: cols
leaf.tooltip: <textarea> Defines the number of columns in a textarea.

leaf.title: content
leaf.tooltip: <meta> A value associated with http-equiv or name depending on the context.

leaf.title: controls
leaf.tooltip: <audio>, <video> Indicates whether the browser should show playback controls to the user.

leaf.title: coords
leaf.tooltip: <area> A set of values specifying the coordinates of the hot-spot region.

leaf.title: crossorigin
csp
leaf.tooltip: Experimental <iframe> Specifies the Content Security Policy that an embedded document must agree to enforce upon itself.

leaf.title: data
leaf.tooltip: <object> Specifies the URL of the resource.

leaf.title: datetime
leaf.tooltip: <del>, <ins>, <time> Indicates the date and time associated with the element.

leaf.title: decoding
leaf.tooltip: Indicates the preferred method to decode the image.

leaf.title: default
leaf.tooltip: <track> Indicates that the track should be enabled unless the user's preferences indicate something different.

leaf.title: defer
leaf.tooltip: <script> Indicates that the script should be executed after the page has been parsed.

leaf.title: dirname
leaf.tooltip: <input>, <textarea>

leaf.title: disabled
leaf.tooltip: <button>, <fieldset>, <input>, <keygen>, <optgroup>, <option>, <select>, <textarea> Indicates whether the user can interact with the element.

leaf.title: download
leaf.tooltip: <a>, <area> Indicates that the hyperlink is to be used for downloading a resource.

leaf.title: enctype
leaf.tooltip: <form> Defines the content type of the form data when the method is POST.

leaf.title: enterkeyhint
leaf.tooltip: Experimental <textarea>, contenteditable The enterkeyhint specifies what action label (or icon) to present for the enter key on virtual keyboards. The attribute can be used with form controls (such as the value of textarea elements), or in elements in an editing host (e.g., using contenteditable attribute).

leaf.title: formaction
leaf.tooltip: <input>, <button> Indicates the action of the element, overriding the action defined in the <form>.

leaf.title: formenctype
leaf.tooltip: <button>, <input> If the button/input is a submit button (type=´submit´), this attribute sets the encoding type to use during form submission. If this attribute is specified, it overrides the enctype attribute of the button's form owner.

leaf.title: formmethod
leaf.tooltip: <button>, <input> If the button/input is a submit button (type=´submit´), this attribute sets the submission method to use during form submission (GET, POST, etc.). If this attribute is specified, it overrides the method attribute of the button's form owner.

leaf.title: formnovalidate
leaf.tooltip: <button>, <input> If the button/input is a submit button (type=´submit´), this boolean attribute specifies that the form is not to be validated when it is submitted. If this attribute is specified, it overrides the novalidate attribute of the button's form owner.

leaf.title: formtarget
leaf.tooltip: <button>, <input> If the button/input is a submit button (type=´submit´), this attribute specifies the browsing context (for example, tab, window, or inline frame) in which to display the response that is received after submitting the form. If this attribute is specified, it overrides the target attribute of the button's form owner.

leaf.title: form
leaf.tooltip: <button>, <fieldset>, <input>, <keygen>, <label>, <meter>, <object>, <output>, <progress>, <select>, <textarea> Indicates the form that is the owner of the element.

leaf.title: for
leaf.tooltip: <label>, <output> Describes elements which belongs to this one.

leaf.title: headers
leaf.tooltip: <td>, <th> IDs of the <th> elements which applies to this element.

leaf.title: height
leaf.tooltip: , ,

leaf.title: high
leaf.tooltip: <meter> Indicates the lower bound of the upper range.

leaf.title: hreflang
leaf.tooltip: <a>, <area>, <link> Specifies the language of the linked resource.

leaf.title: href
leaf.tooltip: <a>, <area>, <base>, <link> The URL of a linked resource.

leaf.title: http-equiv
leaf.tooltip: <meta> Defines a pragma directive.

leaf.title: importance
leaf.tooltip: Experimental

leaf.title: inputmode
leaf.tooltip: <textarea>, contenteditable Provides a hint as to the type of data that might be entered by the user while editing the element or its contents. The attribute can be used with form controls (such as the value of textarea elements), or in elements in an editing host (e.g., using contenteditable attribute).

leaf.title: integrity
leaf.tooltip: <link>, <script> Specifies a Subresource Integrity value that allows browsers to verify what they fetch.

leaf.title: intrinsicsize
leaf.tooltip: Deprecated This attribute tells the browser to ignore the actual intrinsic size of the image and pretend it's the size specified in the attribute.

leaf.title: ismap
leaf.tooltip: Indicates that the image is part of a server-side image map.

leaf.title: keytype
leaf.tooltip: <keygen> Specifies the type of key generated.

leaf.title: kind
leaf.tooltip: <track> Specifies the kind of text track.

leaf.title: label
leaf.tooltip: <optgroup>, <option>, <track> Specifies a user-readable title of the element.

leaf.title: language
leaf.tooltip: Deprecated <script> Defines the script language used in the element.

leaf.title: list
leaf.tooltip: <input> Identifies a list of pre-defined options to suggest to the user.

leaf.title: loading
leaf.tooltip: Experimental ,

leaf.title: loop
leaf.tooltip: <audio>, <bgsound>, <marquee>, <video> Indicates whether the media should start playing from the start when it's finished.

leaf.title: low
leaf.tooltip: <meter> Indicates the upper bound of the lower range.

leaf.title: manifest
leaf.tooltip: Deprecated <html> Specifies the URL of the document's cache manifest. Note: This attribute is obsolete, use <link rel=´manifest´> instead.

leaf.title: maxlength
leaf.tooltip: <input>, <textarea> Defines the maximum number of characters allowed in the element.

leaf.title: max
leaf.tooltip: <input>, <meter>, <progress> Indicates the maximum value allowed.

leaf.title: media
leaf.tooltip: <a>, <area>, <link>, <source>, <style> Specifies a hint of the media for which the linked resource was designed.

leaf.title: method
leaf.tooltip: <form> Defines which HTTP method to use when submitting the form. Can be GET (default) or POST.

leaf.title: minlength
leaf.tooltip: <input>, <textarea> Defines the minimum number of characters allowed in the element.

leaf.title: min
leaf.tooltip: <input>, <meter> Indicates the minimum value allowed.

leaf.title: multiple
leaf.tooltip: <input>, <select> Indicates whether multiple values can be entered in an input of the type email or file.

leaf.title: muted
leaf.tooltip: <audio>, <video> Indicates whether the audio will be initially silenced on page load.

leaf.title: name
leaf.tooltip: <button>, <form>, <fieldset>, <iframe>, <input>, <keygen>, <object>, <output>, <select>, <textarea>, <map>, <meta>, <param> Name of the element. For example used by the server to identify the fields in form submits.

leaf.title: novalidate
leaf.tooltip: <form> This attribute indicates that the form shouldn't be validated when submitted.

leaf.title: open
leaf.tooltip: <details>, <dialog> Indicates whether the contents are currently visible (in the case of a <details> element) or whether the dialog is active and can be interacted with (in the case of a <dialog> element).

leaf.title: optimum
leaf.tooltip: <meter> Indicates the optimal numeric value.

leaf.title: pattern
leaf.tooltip: <input> Defines a regular expression which the element's value will be validated against.

leaf.title: ping
leaf.tooltip: <a>, <area> The ping attribute specifies a space-separated list of URLs to be notified if a user follows the hyperlink.

leaf.title: placeholder
leaf.tooltip: <input>, <textarea> Provides a hint to the user of what can be entered in the field.

leaf.title: playsinline
leaf.tooltip: <video> A Boolean attribute indicating that the video is to be played ´inline´; that is, within the element's playback area. Note that the absence of this attribute does not imply that the video will always be played in fullscreen.

leaf.title: poster
leaf.tooltip: <video> A URL indicating a poster frame to show until the user plays or seeks.

leaf.title: preload
leaf.tooltip: <audio>, <video> Indicates whether the whole resource, parts of it or nothing should be preloaded.

leaf.title: readonly
leaf.tooltip: <input>, <textarea> Indicates whether the element can be edited.

leaf.title: referrerpolicy
leaf.tooltip: , ,

leaf.title: rel
leaf.tooltip: <a>, <area>, <link> Specifies the relationship of the target object to the link object.

leaf.title: required
leaf.tooltip: <input>, <select>, <textarea> Indicates whether this element is required to fill out or not.

leaf.title: reversed
leaf.tooltip: <ol> Indicates whether the list should be displayed in a descending order instead of an ascending order.

leaf.title: rowspan
leaf.tooltip: <td>, <th> Defines the number of rows a table cell should span over.

leaf.title: rows
leaf.tooltip: <textarea> Defines the number of rows in a text area.

leaf.title: sandbox
leaf.tooltip: <iframe> Stops a document loaded in an iframe from using certain features (such as submitting forms or opening new windows).

leaf.title: scoped
leaf.tooltip: Non-standard Deprecated <style>

leaf.title: selected
leaf.tooltip: <option> Defines a value which will be selected on page load.

leaf.title: scope
leaf.tooltip: <th> Defines the cells that the header test (defined in the th element) relates to.

leaf.title: shape
leaf.tooltip: <a>, <area>

leaf.title: size
leaf.tooltip: <input>, <select> Defines the width of the element (in pixels). If the element's type attribute is text or password then it's the number of characters.

leaf.title: sizes
leaf.tooltip: , ,

leaf.title: span
leaf.tooltip: <col>, <colgroup>

leaf.title: srcdoc
leaf.tooltip: <iframe>

leaf.title: srclang
leaf.tooltip: <track>

leaf.title: srcset
leaf.tooltip: , One or more responsive image candidates.

leaf.title: src
start
leaf.tooltip: <ol> Defines the first number if other than 1.

leaf.title: step
leaf.tooltip: <input>

leaf.title: summary
leaf.tooltip: Deprecated <table>

leaf.title: target
leaf.tooltip: <a>, <area>, <base>, <form> Specifies where to open the linked document (in the case of an <a> element) or where to display the response received (in the case of a <form> element)

leaf.title: type
leaf.tooltip: <button>, <input>, <embed>, <object>, <ol>, <script>, <source>, <style>, <menu>, <link> Defines the type of the element.

leaf.title: usemap
leaf.tooltip: , ,

leaf.title: value
leaf.tooltip: <button>, <data>, <input>, <li>, <meter>, <option>, <progress>, <param> Defines a default value which will be displayed in the element on page load.

leaf.title: width
leaf.tooltip: , ,

leaf.title: wrap
leaf.tooltip: <textarea> Indicates whether the text should be wrapped.
